title: Re: Removing Garfield's speech makes the comic funnier
content:
It seems like this is making the rounds on Internet forums. I saw this over on the JCF.

Pretty funny stuff but it only seems to work for Garfield. AND it only seems to work on some, not all, strips. But all in all it does make a horrible syndicated comic a tad bit better. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] -----------------------

title: Re: hehe
content:
I have a nice comic written in 1974, should I try and find it? Its dialouge is:

Jon: Where's my chicken Garfield?

Garfield: ...

Jon *Picks up G and shakes* What've you done with it?

Jon* drops dazed G*

Jon: Dorry, Garfield, sometimes I forget you can't talk.

Garfield: *shows claws* Forget this!

title: Re: hehe
content:
Commercialized, eh.

Jon can sometimes know what Garfield thinks, and sometimes he can't. It depends on the situation. I've seen comics where Jon would reply on what Garfield 'said', and other comics where Jon would wonder what Garfield was thinking (Jon: Garfield, tell me. Am I a loser? Garfield: Yes. Jon: I wish you could talk. Garfield: YES! I SAID YES!).___________________
DaVince, Yet Another Amateur Game Creator! :P

title: Re: hehe
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Actually, i think he can. You can tell by the way Jon responds to what garfield "thinks" with his facial expressions.[hr][/quote]

Well, basically, "what DaVince21 said"! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
In the cases that Jon does know what Garfield is thinking, I'm actually blaming Garfield's very own facial expressions.
Garfield's a cartoon of course, but even with real life animals sometimes you just know what they are thinking.
There's just the way a tail is wagged, or the way a glint in an eye appears, the way a head is held... more subtle stuff.
Of course you can't always be completely sure, but if it's your own pet, you'll definately get a feeling for eachother's emotions, if not thoughts.Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: hehe
content:
Thats the point innit.

Bill Watterson proposed a theory of Comic Evolution, in which a comic is first rather poorly drawn as the artist gets used to drawing his characters, then settles into a period of high quality where storylines and characters are developed, followed by a long and continual decline and decay as the comic focuses on a few specific characters and themes.

Garfield has been around a long time, like its sister comic, Peanuts, its had a long, long time to decay. [Anyone who has some samples of 1950's peanuts will see how evident this is.]

A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society
